ai-tha-ap295:1.4_0: the world is extinguished, the root of suffering.
ai-tha-ap295:3.1_0: I raise my joined palms to one side,
ai-tha-ap295:3.2_0: I paid homage at her and bowed,
ai-tha-ap295:3.4_0: I cooked it on what I did.
ai-tha-ap295:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any bad places
ai-tha-ap295:6.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
ai-tha-ap295:7.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Kaṇṭaka.
ai-tha-ap295:8.1_0: and a third part of the senior monks.
